```{r}
### ---- 2.1. Príprava objektov (nutné pre Task 2) ----

# Sequence vector z Task 1 (pravdepodobná verzia)
seq_vector <- seq(10, 100, by = 10)

# Logical vector z Task 1 (príklad – TRUE/FALSE striedanie)
logical_vector <- c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE)

# Aurora_list z Task 1 (doplnený príklad)
aurora_list <- list(
  description = "Aurora Project Universe",
  seq_vector = seq_vector,
  energy_matrix = matrix(1:9, nrow = 3)
)

# Aurora_df z Task 1 (príkladová verzia)
aurora_df <- data.frame(
  City = c("Nova", "Lumina", "Altair", "Solaria", "Cryos", "Vesper"),
  Population_mil = c(8.2, 5.5, 9.1, 6.3, 4.8, 7.0),
  Is_Coastal = c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE),
  Development_Stage = c("advanced", "developing", "advanced", "emerging", "advanced", "developing"),
  Density_Index = c(120, 95, 140, 110, 90, 130)
)

### ---- 2.1. Querying Vectors ----

## 2.1.1. From the Sequence vector (seq_vector)
seq_vector[3]
seq_vector[2:5]
seq_vector[seq_vector > 50]

## 2.1.2. From the Logical vector (logical_vector)
logical_vector[logical_vector]
which(logical_vector)

### ---- 2.2. Querying Your "Universe" List ----
aurora_list$description
aurora_list[["energy_matrix"]]
aurora_list$seq_vector[2]

### ---- 2.3. Investigating Your Data Frame ----
head(aurora_df, 3)
aurora_df[4, 1]
aurora_df$Is_Coastal

df_subset <- aurora_df[aurora_df$Is_Coastal & aurora_df$Population_mil > 6, ]
df_subset

df_subset_2 <- aurora_df[aurora_df$Development_Stage %in% c("advanced", "developing"), ]
df_subset_2

### ---- 2.4. Handling "Corrupted" Data (NA) ----
df_corrupted <- aurora_df

df_corrupted[2, 2] <- NA
df_corrupted[5, 4] <- NA
df_corrupted[6, 5] <- NA

df_corrupted
sum(is.na(df_corrupted))
colSums(is.na(df_corrupted))
mean(df_corrupted$Population_mil, na.rm = TRUE)

df_clean <- na.omit(df_corrupted)
df_clean

### ---- 2.5. Bonus Challenge: which() ----
highest_pop_index <- which.max(aurora_df$Population_mil)
aurora_df[highest_pop_index, ]

lowest_pop_index <- which.min(aurora_df$Population_mil)
aurora_df[lowest_pop_index, ]
```
